name: untheoretical
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
based on or involving feelings rather than facts, proof, or theory: He criticized the article for being untheoretical and merely descriptive. As an artist, he has always been intuitive and untheoretical. Compare
theoretical
More examplesFewer examplesThe sculptor's untheoretical understanding of the female body is problematic today but the work is so confident that it defies criticism.The introduction of an army produced a quite untheoretical joy in danger, mastery, and victory.English culture is presented as inward-looking, complacent, unreflective, and untheoretical.
